_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The stages of realization of a mendicant: Undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life
Abuses, annoys, or argues back at someone who does the same to them
Doesn't abuse, annoy, or argue back at someone who does the same to them
How a mendicant fumes [an4.200:18.3]: When there is the concept 'I am'
How a mendicant does not fume [an4.200:1: When there is no concept 'I am'
How a mendicant is ignited [an4.200:18.3: When there is the concept 'I am because of this'
How a mendicant is not ignited [an4.200:: When there is no concept 'I am because of this'
How a mendicant burns up [an4.200:18.3]: When a mendicant hasn't given up the conceit 'I am'
How a mendicant does not burn up [an4.20: When a mendicant has given up the conceit 'I am'
